title: Accessing Clean UNAIDS Data
text: vignette covers access clean tidy annual UNAIDS Estimates GitHub Releases. mindthegap package uses cleaning function (munge_edms) (formerly munge_unaids) process, munge, tidy UNAIDS HIV Estimates output EDMS database new estimates available annually (around July) load_unaids load cleaned data session. Let’s start loading mindthegap package.

what: Pull clean data from GitHub Releases
title: Accessing Clean UNAIDS Data
text: new data released annually, team extracts data UNAIDS database runs munge_edms clean tidy dataset, including new variables pepfar flag denote whether country PEPFAR country estimate_flag indicate estimates approximation (previously contained “<” “>”). order make data accessible outside R cut processing time, uploaded clean UNAIDS data package releases; users can easily access data running load_unaids R directly downloading data file. use load_unaids, user just needed specify whether want return countries just PEPFAR ones (pepfar_only = TRUE), default.

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: vignette designed package developers document data extracted UNAIDS Estimates Data pulled EDMS. process conducted annually around July UNAIDS publishes new estimates. data extracted system largely exist Excel file made available AIDSInfo, also extra indicators ‘Total deaths HIV Population’ calculated ‘Incidence mortality ratio (IMR)’

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: order get access EDMS, need provisioned account. UNAIDS point contact OHA/SIEI able make submit request behalf.

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: logged system, first need select Module given year, runs vertically along left hand side page. example, 2024 update titled “O- HIV estimates - 2024 - Spectrum 6.35”.

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: , follow blue tabs top screen, starting “Statistics/Indicators”. Indicators divided different categories, can selected drop . category selected, need select “Sub-category”, typically age groups PMTCT. Finally need select relevant indicators list move using select arrow (‘>’). default, select indicator, also include uncertainty bounds. table details full list data elements need include (modual prefix removed):

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: Next , need navigate Regions/Countries tab select relevant geographies. annual pull, select following geographies, includes regions top list first section (Global - Western central Eurpoe North America) countries (Afghanistan - Saint Lucia, preceeding non-Spectrum list),

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: last selection, need pick years running 1990 present. Note recent year UNAIDS dataset year prior release. example, release 2024 cover data 2023. pull projections annual pull.

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: point, done work now time export . , need sleect button far right labeled “Data list” allow download file csv. ’s important also save query, clicking button labeled “Save query”. enter title subject can access future (amend needed) “Queries” tab.

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: location previously saved tabs. , can click bottom right tab, “Copy chosen query next round” allow perform query future year/module.

title: Extracting and Processing Data from EDMS
text: dataset output EDMS, can process csv file using munge_edms. function run throught series steps importing munging summarizing. epi_95s_flag = TRUE, function also added number additional columns flag epidemic control status well achievement 95 targets. mundge_edms can used process ad hoc outputs database processing dataset go number validations well flag errors warnings along way informative messages help identify something missing pull something amiss. dataset processed, can uploaded GitHub release using publish_release. needs preformed year new data made available. Users now able access tidied data release using load_unaids
code: library(mindthegap)  edms_path <- "Data/DataList_9_19_2024-3_30_17-PM.csv"  df_unaids <- munge_edms(edms_path, epi_95s_flag = TRUE) publish_release(df_unaids) df <- load_unaids()

title: Epidemic Control Plots
text: PEPFAR defines HIV epidemic control “point total number new HIV infections falls total number deaths causes among HIV-infected individuals, declining.” UNAIDS estimates point using Incidence-Mortality Ration (IMR). Epidemic control indicators available data available load_unaids, also includes column called achv_epi_control logical variable whether country met three epidemic control criteria given year (age sex). information can plotted built function, plot_epi_trends, demonstrate .

title: Epidemic Control Plots
text: addition mindthegap make sure glitr installed. need loaded session, needed run plots. Dependent packages typically installed CRAN, since packages rOpenSci, installed.
code: install.packages(c('glitr', 'patchwork'), repos = c('https://usaid-oha-si.r-universe.dev', 'https://cran.r-project.org/')) library(mindthegap) library(ggplot2) library(patchwork)

title: Epidemic Control Plots
text: First, let’s take look plot_epi_trends function action: use function, first load estimates data mindthegap package specify PEPFAR country interest sel_cntry parameter plot_epi_trends function. subtitle includes epi control information given year - direction total death new infections, declining, IMR, 1. case want compare epidemic control across countries, plot_epi_trends function allows list several countries interest sel_cntry parameter well.  addition looking epidemic control country level, can also see trends across PEPFAR just using plot_epi_trends() function, “PEPFAR” default country sel_cntry parameter. aware summing point estimates across PEPFAR countries data points estimated released UNAIDS.  function makes easy generate plots countries interest. Let’s peek hood see function works munge data create plots.
code: df_unaids <- load_unaids() plot_epi_trends(df_unaids, sel_cntry = "Kenya") plot_epi_trends(df_unaids, c("Kenya","Tanzania")) plot_epi_trends(df_unaids)

title: Epidemic Control Plots
text: time-series data often presented linearly, time x-axis, can also use connected scatterplot illustrate country’s journey toward epidemic control. connected scatterplot combines elements scatterplots line charts, providing dynamic view relationship two variables time. context epidemic control, data point represents combination total deaths (x-axis) new HIV infections (y-axis) given year. points connected chronologically show relationship deaths new infections evolves time. goal epidemic control can visualized 45-degree line, indicating balance two indicators. trend line moves closer zero axes, suggests progress toward fewer deaths fewer new infections. connected line trends towards zero, indicates country moving positive direction—toward reduced mortality reduced spread HIV. Points fall closer total deaths axis indicate periods epidemic control approached maintained. Let’s take example Zambia see relationship action. Using plot_connected_scatter() can visualize Zambia’s progress towards epi control. plot_connected_scatter() can also take multiple country arguments make comparison plots. function automatically scale axes , recommended comparing countries similar mangitude epidemic control metrics. Comparing South Africa Rwanda result graphic dominated sheer size epidemic South Africa. , show progress Mozambique, Tanzania Malawi. Coincidentally, country appears similar paths, different points time.  race bottom plots can also combined together countries naturally fall different classes. , countries sorted large small groups depict epidemic control conditioned country’s progress 95s.
code: plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids, sel_cntry = "Zambia") +    labs(title = toupper("Zambia reached epidemic control in 2023")) plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids, sel_cntry = c("Malawi", "Mozambique", "Tanzania")) +   labs(title = toupper("Malawi reached epidemic control in 2023.")) # Lump countries into buckets of progress and size of epidemic   near_95s_large <- c( "Zambia", "Kenya", "Zimbabwe", "Malawi")   near_95s_small <- c("Eswatini", "Botswana", "Rwanda", "Namibia", "Lesotho")      # Store groups in a list with corresponding titles   country_groups <- list(     "Near 95s Large" = near_95s_large,     "Near 95s Small" = near_95s_small     )      # Create a plot for each group with the title as a label   plots <- purrr::map2(country_groups, names(country_groups),   ~ plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids, sel_cntry = .x) +     labs(title = .y, caption = NULL) +     theme(legend.position = "none"))      # Combine the plots into a 2-row, 3-column layout using patchwork   combined_plot <- patchwork::wrap_plots(plots, ncol = 2) +      labs(caption = source_note)    # Display the final plot   print(combined_plot)

title: 95-95-95 Target Progress: Relative Base vs. PLHIV Base
text: 2020, UNAIDS updated Fast Track targets (90-90-90) 2024 become 95-95-95 targets set achieved 2030 - 95% PLHIV know status, 95% know status accessing treatment, 95% accessing treatment virally suppressed. Importantly, two types metrics measure 95-95-95 target progress : PLHIV base relative/conditional denominator base. vignette outline key differences two metrics, UNAIDS indicators use , interpret different parameters.

title: 95-95-95 Target Progress: Relative Base vs. PLHIV Base
text: addition mindthegap make sure glitr installed. need loaded session, needed run plots. Dependent packages typically installed CRAN, since packages rOpenSci, installed.
code: install.packages('glitr', repos = c('https://usaid-oha-si.r-universe.dev', 'https://cran.r-project.org/')) #> Installing package into '/home/runner/work/_temp/Library' #> (as 'lib' is unspecified) library(mindthegap)

what: What’s the difference between the relative base and the PLHIV base?
title: 95-95-95 Target Progress: Relative Base vs. PLHIV Base
text: relative base conditional denominator (based targets) important countries programs know focus response. metric provides values sliding scale, 95% PLHIV know status, 95% know status accessing treatment, 95% accessing treatment virally suppressed. PLHIV base/denominator (testing treatment cascade) best used comparing countries knowing country-specific progress towards curbing HIV epidemic. PLHIV base 3 95’s, targets become 95% PLHIV known status, 90% PLHIV accessing treatment, 86% PLHIV virally suppressed. useful, different purposes (see visual ).

what: How to use UNAIDS Data to Assess 95’s Progress
title: 95-95-95 Target Progress: Relative Base vs. PLHIV Base
text: assess progress 95-95-95 targets, can use indicators available EDMS. Percent Known Status PLHIV: Percent PLHIV known HIV status Percent ART Known Status: Among know status, percent ART Percent VLS ART: Among ART, percent virally suppressed Percent Known Status PLHIV: Percent PLHIV known HIV status Percent ART PLHIV: Among PLHVIV, percent ART Percent VLS PLHIV: Among PLHIV, percent virally suppressed package built function, tab_95s, generate datatable . Let’s take deep dive Namibia’s progress 95’s using PLHIV base. can see, using PLHIV base, Namibia reached one 95’s - 93% PLHIV know status; 89% PLHIV accessing treatment; 87% PLHIV virally suppressed. happens use relative base? Using relative base, can see - 93% PLHIV know status; 95% know status accessing treatment; 98% treatment virally suppressed. , Namibia meets 2nd 3rd 95 relative base, reach 1st 95. result differences 2 metrics, number PEPFAR countries reached 95’s can vary depending denominator. PLHIV base, 7 countries reached 3 95’s: Botswana, Kenya, Malawi, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Eswatini, Zambia. relative base, 7 countries reached 3 95’s: Botswana, Kenya, Malawi, Rwanda, Zimbabwe, Eswatini, Zambia.
code: df_unaids <- load_unaids() v_plhiv <- tab_95s(df_unaids, "Namibia", denom = "PLHIV", grp = "All") #> ! Before proceeding, we recommend installing the Source Sans 3 or Source Sans Pro from USAID Software Center or Google Fonts (<https://fonts.google.com/specimen/Source+Sans+3>). In the absense of Source Sans 3 or Pro, we will default to using Arial v_plhiv v_relative <- tab_95s(df_unaids, "Namibia", denom = "Relative", grp = "All") v_relative

title: Data Dictionary & Use Cases
text: vignette serves data dictionary UNAIDS Estimates Data pulled EDMS. cover data structure variables, well provide overview indicators included. Finally, touch briefly common use cases data tab access analytics.

title: Data Dictionary & Use Cases
text: Let’s first take look data structure. data panel dataset countries 1990 2023 reporting 19 different indicators. indicators may disaggregated combination age sex seen table . also important mention values provided estimates, lower upper bounds. Estimates may reported character values, e.g. “<100” “>98”. order analyze plot data, removed character values noted estimate_flag column. also provided additional columns dataset: pepfar: logical value notes whether country PEPFAR country indicator_type: character value tells whether estimate integer, percentage, rate, ratio achv_95_plhiv achv_95_relative: logical value identifies whether country given year achieved three 95 goals (PLHIV relative base, see ) point estimate. achievement broken age sex group (, 0-15, 15+, Female/15+ Male/15+) achv_epi_control: logical value identifies whether country given year achieved three requirements epidemic control (IMR less 1 new infections deaths declining, see ). can see, multiple different disaggregates, especially across indicators. instance, looking “Number AIDS Related Deaths”, total age disaggregates 0-14 15+, broken sex. , important filter age/sex/indicator type disaggregates interested diving analytics avoid potential double counting.
code: df_unaids <- load_unaids(pepfar_only = TRUE) glimpse(df_unaids) #> Rows: 67,868 #> Columns: 16 #> $ year             <int> 1990, 1990, 1990, 1990, 1990, 1990, 1990, 1990, 1990,… #> $ iso              <chr> "AGO", "AGO", "AGO", "AGO", "AGO", "AGO", "AGO", "AGO… #> $ country          <chr> "Angola", "Angola", "Angola", "Angola", "Angola", "An… #> $ pepfar           <lgl> TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE,… #> $ region           <chr> "Eastern and southern Africa", "Eastern and southern … #> $ indicator        <chr> "Prevalence", "Prevalence", "Prevalence", "Number AID… #> $ indicator_type   <chr> "Rate", "Rate", "Rate", "Integer", "Integer", "Intege… #> $ age              <chr> "15-49", "15-24", "15-24", "All", "0-14", "15+", "All… #> $ sex              <chr> "All", "Female", "Male", "All", "All", "All", "All", … #> $ estimate         <dbl> 8.0e-01, 7.0e-01, 3.0e-01, 2.8e+03, 1.2e+03, 1.6e+03,… #> $ lower_bound      <dbl> 5.0e-01, 3.0e-01, 1.0e-01, 1.6e+03, 7.0e+02, 9.1e+02,… #> $ upper_bound      <dbl> 1.0, 1.2, 0.5, 3800.0, 1500.0, 2300.0, 100.0, 6600.0,… #> $ estimate_flag    <chr> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, "less than", NA, NA, NA, NA, … #> $ achv_95_plhiv    <lgl> NA, NA, NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,… #> $ achv_95_relative <lgl> NA, NA, NA, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,… #> $ achv_epi_control <lgl> NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, NA, N…

title: Mind the Gap
text: mindthegap developed 2019 preparation agency self assessments COP show UNAIDS 90-90-90 Progress ART Gap. turned package process, clean, export tidy UNAIDS Estimates data ease access. year, package evolved meet needs Office HIV/AIDS. current release shifts emphasis UNAIDS 95-95-95 goals. Please see Articles section Changelog details.

title: Mind the Gap
text: mindthegap CRAN, install directly rOpenSci GitHub using code found .
code: ## SETUP    #install from rOpenSci     install.packages(c('mindthegap', 'glitr'), repos = c('https://usaid-oha-si.r-universe.dev', getOption("repos")))        #alt: install from GitHub using pak     #install.packages("pak")     #pak::pak("USAID-OHA-SI/mindthegap")     #pak::pak("USAID-OHA-SI/glitr")        #load the package     library(mindthegap)  ## LIST TYPES OF STYLES INCLUDED WITH PACKAGE   ls("package:mindthegap")

title: Mind the Gap
text: UNAIDS data reports HIV estimates uncertainty bounds 1990 onward, includes epidemic control indicators indicators show progress 95s. data sourced UNAIDS EDMS, originally UNAIDS data database. Data available updated July UNAIDS issues new releases. access core set UNAIDS Data see example using load_unaids(). core dataset contains epidemic control 95-95-95 goals indicators. view available indicators count() indicator column dataset. Additionally, data can manually downloaded GitHub Releases page. Disclaimer: findings, interpretation, conclusions expressed herein authors necessarily reflect views United States Agency International Development. errors remain .
code: library(mindthegap)  #load data  df_unaids <- load_unaids(pepfar_only = TRUE)  #review structure  str(df_unaids)   #review available indicators  df_unaids %>% count(indicator)  #plot epi curve  plot_epi_trends(df_unaids, sel_cntry = "Kenya")  #plot epi curve with a connected scatterplot  plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids, sel_cntry = "Zambia")  #plot UNAIDS 95 target achievement  tab_95s(df_unaids, "Namibia", denom = "PLHIV", grp = "All")

text: internal function adds custom text annotation ggplot object, positioning specified proportion plot's x y axis ranges. default annotation used indicate epidemic control.

code: adorn_annotation(   p,   annotation_label = "<-- Epidemic control",   annotation_proportion = 0.9 )

title: Add Annotation to a ggplot Object — adorn_annotation
text: p ggplot2 plot object annotation added. annotation_label character string specifying text annotate plot . default value "<– Epidemic control". annotation_proportion numeric value 0 1 indicating position annotation relative axis ranges. Default 0.9, placing annotation close top-right plot.

title: Plot Epidemic Control Trajectories — plot_connected_scatter
text: Generates connected scatterplot trajectories deaths new infections specified countries.

title: Plot Epidemic Control Trajectories — plot_connected_scatter
text: .data data frame containing epidemiological data. include columns country, year, indicator, estimate, others required processing. sel_cntry character vector countries include plot. year_range numeric vector specifying range years include analysis. Default 2010:2023.

title: Plot Epidemic Control Trajectories — plot_connected_scatter
text: ggplot2 plot object showing epidemic control trajectories deaths x-axis new infections y-axis.

title: Plot Epidemic Control Trajectories — plot_connected_scatter
text: function serves wrapper, orchestrating preparation, calculation, visualization data. processes input data, calculates appropriate axis limits, constructs epidemic control plot, finally adds annotation epidemic control.

title: Plot Epidemic Control Trajectories — plot_connected_scatter
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{    df_unaids <- load_unaids(pepfar_only = FALSE)    plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids)    plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids, sel_cntry = "Lesotho")    plot_connected_scatter(df_unaids, sel_cntry = c("South Africa", "Zambia", "Kenya", "Malawi")) } # }

what: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
title: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
text: function filters processes UNAIDS epidemiological data selecting relevant indicators ("Number Total Deaths HIV Population" "Number New HIV Infections"), reshaping data wide format, renaming resulting columns readability. intended prepare dataset race bottom visualization.

title: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
text: df data frame containing pre-processed UNAIDS EDMS data. sel_cntry character vector country names data filtered. function filter dataset include countries. year_range numeric vector specifying range years filter dataset . data within range retained.

title: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
text: filtered reshaped data frame containing selected countries, indicators, years. resulting data frame includes columns region, country, year, iso, pepfar, estimates deaths infections.

title: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
text: function first filters data include selected countries (sel_cntry), specified year range (year_range), indicators "Number Total Deaths HIV Population" "Number New HIV Infections". selects columns relevant analysis, reshapes data wide format, renames indicator columns deaths infections better readability. data matches provided filters, error thrown inform user.

title: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
text: function assumes dataset includes age sex categories set "". Make sure provide correctly formatted dataset verify country names avoid errors.

title: Prepare UNAIDS Epidemiological Data for Analysis — prep_epi_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   # Load a sample UNAIDS dataset   df_unaids <- load_unaids() # Assume this function loads your dataset    # Prepare data for Lesotho for the years 2010-2023   df_prepared <- prep_epi_data(df_unaids, sel_cntry = "Lesotho", year_range = 2010:2023) } # }

title: mindthegap 2.0
text: Updated vignettes include new plotting functions short section plot_connected_scatter functionality [2024-10-24] Renamed base_plot tab_95s better reflect ’s purpose [2024-10-24] Renamed epi_plot plot_epi_trends better reflect ’s purpose standardize plot function names [2024-10-24] Enhanced plotting options plot_connected_scatter – function create race bottom connected scatterplot [2024-10-24] Add new vignette developers extract process EDMS output [2024-10-07] Update vignettes changed indicators structure [2024-10-07] Allow base_plot provide achievement across different age/sex groups [2024-10-03] Updated base_plot handle new data structure reduce redundancy [2024-10-03] Add publish_release standardize update GH developers [2024-10-03] Deprecate munge_unaids maintained (now using munge_edms) may yeild incorrect results [2024-10-03] Improve performance plot_epi force user provide dataframe [2024-10-02] Include Incidence-Mortality Ration (IMR) expected output EDMS used IMR calculate epi control [2024-10-01] Excluded Incidence 15-49 (INC%) expected output EDMS due data EDMS decimal place exists AIDInfo [2024-10-01] Remove long depricated functions: load_data() unaids_hdrs [2024-10-01] Replace tidyselect, glamr, googlesheet4 references/Imports [2024-10-01] Develop unit tests munge_edms help ensures code performing expected annual updates make updating/catching errors easier [2024-09-24] Create munge_edms (internal sub functions + data) handing UNAIDS data directly EDMS database [2024-09-23]

title: mindthegap 1.1
text: Added codebook output [2024-08-02] Simplified number package dependencies [2024-08-02] Resolve vignette issue withe pkgdown [2024-08-02] Converted static year references dyanmic ones [2024-08-01] Update pull_unaids allow user specify data type return data frame [2024-08-01] Added unaids_year make current year dynamic back end [2024-08-01] Updated Google Ids Sheet names work 2024 data [2024-06-23] Change instructions install rOpenSci [2024-01-04] Deprecate outdated function internalize ones needed within package [2023-10-13] Create wrappers around pull_unaids, pull_estimates pull_testtreat minimize typing improve clarity [2022-10-13] Duplicate release “latest” tag minimizing confusion manual updating future [2022-10-13] Quiet output user running pull_unaids [2022-10-13]

title: mindthegap 1.0.0
